results.title: Conservation cropping
results.creator_credit: Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: This compilation tape specifically targets the wheat and sheep area of the Mallee Region and looks at ways that soil erosion can be avoided. The four episodes shown are: “Trash is treasure.”, Blade aid”, “Croppers” and “Mallee Modifiers.

results.title: Conservation conscious
results.creator_credit: Anna Jeffries, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and QPIX Ltd
results.brief_description:
Richard McDonald and Vicki Locke are two very dedicated and passionate art conservators who work from their solar-powered home in the Sunshine Coast Hinterland’s rainforest. Being “conservation conscious” is not only reflected in their work but also in their philosophy on life.
A mini-documentary written, directed and edited by Anna Jeffries with cinematography and music by Nick Batterham.

results.title: Conservation and our forests
results.brief_description: Explains why forests are a valuable natural resource. Tells how, through conservation, a continuing supply of wood products can be made available without destroying the forest. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Consequences: spinal cord injury
results.creator_credit: University of Washington, Barry Corbet and Peter M Jamero
results.brief_description: Contrasts the excitement and exhilaration of adventure sports such as surfing, motorcycling, skiing, skateboarding and hang gliding, with the potential consequences of spinal cord injury and permanent paralysis. Emphasises learning your limitations, respecting them and recognising the risks.

results.title: Consenting adult
results.creator_credit: Starger Company, Ray Aghayan, David Lawrence and Gilbert Cates
results.brief_description: Set in the pre-AIDS era, this made for television film focuses on the story of a family torn apart when their son announces he is a “homosexual”. All American college student Jeff Lynd (Barry Tubb) is the only son of an ill and emotionally inept father (Martin Sheen) and well intentioned home-maker mother (Marlo Thomas). Fearing his father’s reaction, Jeff comes out to his mother and asks her for help, she misinterprets this as believing he wants to be “cured” and sends her son to a psychiatrist. When her husband finds out Jeff is gay and does not want to be “cured”, he disowns him, fracturing the family further. Jeff finds a sympathetic ear with his married sister Margie (Talia Balsam), but remains estranged from his father until death finally brings them tenuously and posthumously together. Jeff comes out in the first fifteen minutes of the film, consequently the remainder of the film is about how the family react to the news; shock, disbelief, anger and confused acceptance. The representation of Jeff’s sexual awakening is chastely portrayed off screen; presumably it’s the content matter that has prescribed the M rating. Based on the novel by Laura Z. Hobson.

results.title: Conrad Martens
results.creator_credit: National Trust of Australia and Clytie Jessop
results.brief_description: Concerns the life and work of early Colonial artist Conrad Martens whose paintings and sketches are a valuable historical record of Australia. Deals with Marten’s work in England, his voyage on “The Beagle” and his friendship with Charles Darwin, and his output in Sydney.

results.title: Conquest of the sea
results.brief_description: An exploration of the world under the water by aqua-lung divers near Adelaide in South Australia. This film shows glimpses of the unsurpassed beauty of underwater exploration, including sponges, red mullet, rock flathead, cowries, leather jackets and coral fish with long, narrow snouts. Wreck remains show that nature still challenges man.

results.title: Conquest of the rivers
results.creator_credit: Snowy Mountains Authority and H Malcolm
results.brief_description: Shows through the experiences of a new recruit to the Snowy Mountains Scheme how this great enterprise was carried out. There are dramatic scenes from inside the thirty-seven mile tunnel which is an essential feature of the work. Other views include the blasting of roads, dam-building, and the life of families in the new frontier towns of the Australian Alps. Uses archival footage.

results.title: Conquest of the dark
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe, Howard Thomas and Douglas Clarke
results.brief_description: Through the story of one man who loses his sight and who, with expert and sympathetic training, finds self-confidence and financial independence, the film illustrates the work which organised welfare of the blind is doing in Britain. It emphasises that in selected occupations the blind person can compete on terms of equality with the sighted, and shows many aspects of industrial rehabilitation.
